Title: AI Software Engineer
HTML:
At Globant, we are working to make the world a better place, one step at a time. We enhance business development and enterprise solutions to prepare them for a digital future. With a diverse and talented team present in more than 30 countries, we are strategic partners to leading global companies in their business process transformation.

We seek an AI Software Engineer who shares our passion for innovation and change. This role is critical to helping our business partners evolve and adapt to consumers' personalized expectations in this new technological era.

You will get the chance to:

  • Deploy and manage AI models in production environments, ensuring reliability and optimal performance;
  • Design and develop user interfaces and front-end systems that facilitate AI functionality;
  • Integrate and manage various data sources to support AI operations, ensuring data integrity and accessibility;
  • Create and maintain APIs for seamless interaction between system components, enhancing infrastructure integration;
  • Develop scalable frameworks for AI model deployment within the company infrastructure.


What will help you succeed:

  • At least 5 years in software development, with a minimum of 2 years focused on AI-related projects;
  • Demonstrated experience in a senior or leadership role, with the ability to mentor junior team members and lead complex projects;
  • Advanced proficiency in Python and/or Java;
  • Hands-on experience with AI frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, and generative AI tools such as LangChain or Langraph;
  • Familiarity with software development methodologies such as Agile, DevOps, and MLOps;
  • Proven ability to work effectively with data scientists and machine learning engineers in multidisciplinary teams;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to delivering high-quality solutions;
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for AI solution deployment;
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes for managing AI applications;
  • Knowledge of Git and CI/CD pipelines for an efficient, automated workflow;
  • Fluent English.


Create with us digital products that people love. We will bring businesses and consumers together through AI technology and creativity, driving digital transformation to positively impact the world.

At Globant, we believe in fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a thriving and inclusive environment for all employees and candidates, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know by applying through our Career Site or contacting your assigned recruiter.

We may use AI and machine learning technologies in our recruitment process. Compensation is determined based on skills, qualifications, experience, and location. In addition to competitive salaries, we offer a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion and Globant’s Benefits.

Title: Experienced Data Scientist Digital
Description:
Stiamo cercando una figura consultant/senior consultant da inserire nel team Customer Analytics di Deloitte Digital nella sede di Milano/Roma che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Il team Customer Analytics di Deloitte Digital si occupa di supportare i nostri clienti nella individuazione di soluzioni e modelli finalizzati al miglioramento della produttività, efficienza, qualità dei servizi offerti, anche con il supporto delle nuove tecnologie.

Sarai coinvolto nel supporto delle attività legate al mondo della marketing technology: dalla definizione strategica, all’analisi dei requisiti di progetto alla definizione della sua architettura, dallo sviluppo funzionale dell’applicativo fino alla sua delivery.

Your Role

La risorsa Experienced verrà inserita in un team di lavoro:


Di sviluppatori impegnati nell'esecuzione di progetti e in attività di ricerca e sviluppo (R&D).
Sarà responsabile dello sviluppo e dell'implementazione di tecnologie all'avanguardia (Computer vision, NLP, GenAI).
I candidati ideali saranno esperti nell'uso di tecnologie all'avanguardia come computer vision, elaborazione del linguaggio naturale (NLP), GenAI, analisi delle serie temporali, reti neurali grafiche e altri sottodomini dell'AI/ML per risolvere complessi problemi aziendali in settori diversi come il consumo, i servizi finanziari, le telecomunicazioni, le utility, ecc.


Winning Requirements


Laurea triennale richiesta, preferibilmente in un campo correlato alle STEM (Data Science, Informatica, Ingegneria, Fisica, Matematica, ecc.)
Oltre 2 anni di esperienza in data science e analisi di rete, inclusi lo sviluppo di algoritmi AI/ML e l'analisi dei dati nelle principali modalità di dati da NLP, analisi delle serie temporali, computer vision, a modelli grafici.
Oltre 2 anni di esperienza nei linguaggi di programmazione principali e nei pacchetti di data science (Python, Keras, Tensorflow, PyTorch, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter, XGBoost, lgbm ecc.)
Nice to Have:
Esperienza di lavoro con LLMs (GPT, LLaMA, Claude, ecc.) e modelli multimodali.
Capacità di implementare modelli AI in applicazioni reali utilizzando pipeline ML e servizi cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Solida comprensione della modellazione probabilistica, dell'apprendimento non supervisionato e delle tecniche di interpretabilità dei modelli.
Esperienza pratica con database vettoriali, generazione aumentata dal recupero (RAG) e ingegneria dei prompt.
Familiarità con le pratiche MLOps per il deployment e il monitoraggio scalabile dei modelli.
Esperienza con la containerizzazione (Docker) e lo sviluppo di API per il deployment e l'integrazione dei modelli è un plus.

To Make an Impact that Matters

Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.

In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformantion, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo.

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che – in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti – hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.
Show more

Title: Graduate Program 2025 - Data Science & Analytics
Description:
Are you looking to kick off your career journey?

Do you like the idea of joining the European PayTech?




If so, you are at the right place!




Our graduate program offers you the chance to create your unique career path within our diverse international team, operating in more than 25 countries. Rotate among different departments, learn from experienced professionals, and make a difference by working on real business cases.




About the program

Our Graduate Program is more than a learning path - it's a journey where you will work on real business cases and have a direct impact on business results.




What can you expect?

Permanent position in one of the business departments from the start of your employment.
Two rotations between different business departments during the 12-month program.
Project Management and Communication training path after the first six months.
Continuous learning and skill improvement through structured training sessions at our Digital PayTech University.
Opportunity to develop business ideas, implement them, and build your network of stakeholders within a group of highly skilled business leaders from all over Europe.




Exciting Opportunities in Data Science and Analytics

As part of our Data Science and Analytics team, you will contribute to data-driven decision-making in the Paytech industry. You'll work in positions such as Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and BI Data Engineer.




In this department, you'll analyse large datasets, transform data into insights, develop predictive models, and create data visualisations to support business strategies. This role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools and technologies, enhancing your analytical skills and significantly impacting our company's success.




As part of our selection process, the top candidates will be invited to participate in an exciting hackathon at our office location. This is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with peers, and potentially secure a spot on our team. Stay tuned for more details!




What makes you stand out as the ideal participant for this program?

If you see yourself in the description that follows, you should definitely take the first step and apply!

You have a master's degree in Engineering, STEM or Economics & Business, graduated within the last 12 months or will graduate in 2025.
You are a career starter with no more than one year of working experience.
You are fluent in English and in the local language of the country you are applying for (any additional language is beneficial).
You can easily imagine working in an international environment and actively collaborating with colleagues from all over Europe (if you have study or work-related international experience from abroad, that will be considered a beneficial qualification).
You are committed to your work, have an exciting university career with proven great results, enjoy learning new things, feel confident to own projects by yourself and like being part of a team.
For you, formal training is a starting point - you always look for more and want to make a difference in everything you work on.




Apply Now!

Don't miss out on this amazing opportunity. Apply today and discover what's in it for you!




We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong. By applying to our Graduate Program, you're one step closer to joining us.




We're excited to learn more about you!

Show more

  • Continuous learning and skill improvement through structured training sessions at our Digital PayTech University.
  • Opportunity to develop business ideas, implement them, and build your network of stakeholders within a group of highly skilled business leaders from all over Europe.


Exciting Opportunities in Data Science and Analytics

As part of our Data Science and Analytics team, you will contribute to data-driven decision-making in the Paytech industry. You'll work in positions such as Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and BI Data Engineer.


In this department, you'll analyse large datasets, transform data into insights, develop predictive models, and create data visualisations to support business strategies. This role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools and technologies, enhancing your analytical skills and significantly impacting our company's success.


As part of our selection process, the top candidates will be invited to participate in an exciting hackathon at our office location. This is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with peers, and potentially secure a spot on our team. Stay tuned for more details!


What makes you stand out as the ideal participant for this program?

If you see yourself in the description that follows, you should definitely take the first step and apply!

  • You have a master's degree in Engineering, STEM or Economics & Business, graduated within the last 12 months or will graduate in 2025.
  • You are a career starter with no more than one year of working experience.
  • You are fluent in English and in the local language of the country you are applying for (any additional language is beneficial).
  • You can easily imagine working in an international environment and actively collaborating with colleagues from all over Europe (if you have study or work-related international experience from abroad, that will be considered a beneficial qualification).
  • You are committed to your work, have an exciting university career with proven great results, enjoy learning new things, feel confident to own projects by yourself and like being part of a team.
  • For you, formal training is a starting point - you always look for more and want to make a difference in everything you work on.


Apply Now!

Don't miss out on this amazing opportunity. Apply today and discover what's in it for you!


We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong. By applying to our Graduate Program, you're one step closer to joining us.


We're excited to learn more about you!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise:


Asset management
Energy transition services
Energy supply & global commodities
Risk management & market access


At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The position belongs to the Quantitative Data Analysts team in Belgium (Brussels) specifically dedicated to assist the management of risks for belgian B2C and B2B Energy Suppliers. As a member of the quantitative analysts community of the Business Platform Downstream, one can also contribute to transversal projects impacting the activity of other commercial BUs. The main missions associated with the position are :


Based on data collection and analysis, to build models, tools, processes and data representations, that are used to manage the commodity risks linked to the dynamics of a Supply portfolio
The purpose of this work is to operate and optimize costing, forecasting, sourcing and hedging strategies, within a defined mandate


The quantitative analyst / data scientist will do the design, but also the development and ensure the delivery of these models and tools. Beyond that, he will also provide scientific expertise for bespoke analysis, related to data or models. Role:

The daily responsibilities of the new role will include:


Contribute to the development of the tools, models, process and portfolio/data representation used for

Representation of all commodity exposures and associated risks (evolution of the commercial position, climatic impact on short term consumption forecasts, ...)
New commercial offers
Customer behavior analysis

Ensure the run of models and derived operations
Provide BUs B2C and B2B Belgium with a deep knowledge of its commodity sales portfolios (Natural Gas, Power and Certificates) and optimally structure the portfolio representation
Use large range of data to ensure correct representation
Promote good practice, especially around data and code
Ensure code quality by following general rules and standards
Interact with other quantitative analysts/data scientists, to exchange about models, data, business or technical topics beyond the team

Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong scientific background: mathematics (probability/statistics), data science, machine learning, ideally with good command of time series forecasting
Strong skills in software (ideally Python) programming and related tools (versioning, etc.)
Willingness to embrace data handling and operational analytics
Practical thinking, hands-on approach
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues to non-experts in a simple and pedagogic way

Good to have:

Interest for the Energy markets and Energy-transition topics
Knowledge of modern data science platforms and engines such as Databricks and Spark is a plus

Soft skills:


Must have:

Team-player, Transparent, Favor collaboration and working together




Good to have:

Practical thinking

Education and professional background:


University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics
Ideally 1-2 years of experience in the development of modelling tools, ideally with a good knowledge of electricity & gas markets


Languages:


F lu ent in En g lish


Travels:


Occasional travels (mostly to CWE countries)


If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals. All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Business Unit: GEMS

Divisie: GEMS - EC QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH & MODELING

Juridische entiteit: ELECTRABEL

Professionele werkervaring: Ervaren, (3-15 jaar ervaring)

Opleidingsniveau: WO / Master opleiding

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!




At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?




About the job




🤠 What you'll be doing

Design and implement machine learning models to solve complex business problems
Develop data pipelines and workflows for large-scale data processing
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business challenges and define data science objectives
Create and maintain predictive models, optimization algorithms, and statistical analyses
Communicate findings and recommendations through compelling visualizations and reports
Stay current with advancements in machine learning and data science methodologies
Test, validate, and fine-tune models for accuracy and scalability
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data integrity and availability
Contribute to the development of the company’s data strategy and best practices




🤓 Skills & qualifications

3+ years of experience in a data science or related role
Proficiency in Python or R, with a strong understanding of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large datasets
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and probability
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git)
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
A proactive and innovative mindset with attention to detail
Fluent in French or Dutch with good command of English
A passion for turning data into actionable insights




😍 Movify offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular team-building activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist – Gen AI

Location: Brussels (BeCentral) – Hybrid (2 days/week on-site)

Contract Type: Employee or subcontractor employee (no freelancers)

Language Requirements: Fluent in English; Dutch and/or French is a plus

Start Date: ASAP

Work Permit: Must be based in Belgium




🚀 Are you passionate about AI and eager to work on cutting-edge Generative AI projects?

Join a fast-growing innovation center specialized in AI and Cybersecurity. Work in a dynamic and collaborative environment where data scientists, data engineers, and analytics translators come together to design, develop, and deploy AI-driven applications aligned with business goals.




🎯 Your Role




As a Data Scientist – Gen AI, you will be involved in the full lifecycle of AI use cases, from understanding business challenges to deploying solutions into production environments. You’ll have the opportunity to:

Develop AI applications using Gen AI technologies
Translate complex business needs into AI-based solutions
Collaborate with business experts, IT teams, and fellow data scientists
Deploy scalable prototypes into production environments
Present your work clearly to multi-functional teams and stakeholders




🧠 Your Profile




Education & Experience:

PhD or Master’s in AI, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, or similar
3–5 years of experience in a business setting




Technical Skills:




Strong coding skills in Python
Familiarity with Git and CI/CD practices
Proficient with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services
Hands-on experience with LangChain and/or LangGraph
Solid understanding of AI and statistical methods
End-to-end experience with AI project lifecycle (from scoping to deployment)




Soft Skills:




Passionate about continuous learning and AI innovation
Autonomous and proactive in project management
Strong communication skills across technical and non-technical teams
Telecom industry experience is a plus

Ready to build the next generation of AI-driven solutions?




📩 Apply now or contact us for more details.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We're partnered with a VC-backed climate tech startup whose mission is to drive climate action through data. Their intelligent platform empowers organisations to tackle climate issues by monitoring their carbon footprint. It's currently being used by global sustainability leaders!




On the hunt for TWO talented Machine Learning Engineers with experience in Search, Recommendation Engines, and Text Classification to join our dynamic team. You'll collaborate with developers, scientists, and experts to improve AI features that are at the core of what we do. If you're someone who loves taking ownership of projects and working in a team, this could be a great fit for you!




What you’ll do:

Build, develop, and maintain ML models, NLP, and Information Retrieval systems that power carbon intelligence globally.
Deliver key data and insights through platforms that support major enterprises in their climate action efforts.
Experiment and optimize models (like transformers, classifiers, LLMs) to improve our product’s search and recommendation engine.
Keep our data pipelines in check, ensuring everything’s ready for modeling.
Deploy and manage models using AWS SageMaker, Flask, and Pydantic.




What you’ll need:

Extensive experience in Machine Learning, specifically with Search, Classification, and Information Retrieval.
Python experience, specifically working with data pipelines and REST APIs.
A self-starter who enjoys problem-solving and working independently.
Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with remote teams.




What's in it for you?:

Genuinely making a positive impact on the planet
Salary €100K-120K
Benefits, including employee stock options
As a remote-first company, their team collaborates from locations across Europe.




If this is of interest to you, please apply now!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).

Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment

Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM’s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM’s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...) is an asset;
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.

Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.

Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Fincons Group is an IT business consulting company that has been designing the digital future of leading companies on international markets for 40 years. Fincons Group built its reputation on foreseeing and interpreting new business models and the rapid evolution of IT systems by building a complete range of services: from research and consulting to design and development, from system integration of leading vendor software solutions right up to application management, supporting clients step by step along their digital transformation journey. Fincons is a multinational with over 2,600 people and several offices worldwide (in Italy, Switzerland, Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Belgium and the USA), but above all a Family Company where the founders play a strategic role with commitment and passion, grounding the company in the same principles of a united and caring family.

We firmly believe in the value of cooperation and in the contribution that every idea and intuition can bring. We believe that everyone’s effort can make a difference. Transforming knowledge into a strategic resource is our company mission, and we pursue it with the help of our most strategic asset: our people.




Fincons is looking for a Data Scientist




with strong hands-on experience in Microsoft Azure ecosystem, particularly with Azure Fabric, Power BI, and AI/ML integration to support the enhancement of existing systems and APIs through intelligent solutions.




Technical Skills




🔹 Cloud and Platform Expertise

Extensive hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure, including:
Azure Machine Learning
Azure Data Factory
Azure Synapse Analytics
Azure Data Lake Storage
Azure Databricks (nice to have)
Practical knowledge of Microsoft Fabric for data engineering and analytics scenarios.
Familiarity with Azure DevOps, including pipelines and automated deployment.




🔹 Data Science & AI

Solid practical experience in machine learning model development and deployment, including:
Supervised and unsupervised learning
Feature engineering and model evaluation
Experience with model integration into production systems/APIs
Strong Python programming skills, including:
Use of libraries like pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, matplotlib, TensorFlow or PyTorch (at least one)
Understanding of MLOps principles and lifecycle in Azure ML.




🔹 Data Integration & Engineering

Ability to connect and transform data from multiple sources using Azure services and APIs.
Experience working with structured and semi-structured data (SQL, JSON, XML).
Familiarity with data pipeline orchestration, performance tuning, and error handling.




🔹 Power BI & Visualization

Proficiency in Power BI, including:
Building dynamic dashboards
DAX expressions
DirectQuery vs Import models
Gateway setup and refresh optimization
Ability to translate analytical insights into business-friendly visualizations.




Additional Skills (Nice to Have)

Experience with OpenAI/ChatGPT or Azure OpenAI Services.
Knowledge of API architecture, RESTful APIs, and integrating AI models into API workflows.
Exposure to CI/CD pipelines and containerization (Docker/Kubernetes).
Microsoft certifications (e.g., Azure Data Scientist Associate, Power BI Data Analyst Associate).




Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving mindset and analytical skills.
Ability to work independently and within cross-functional Agile teams.
Clear communicator, capable of explaining complex models to non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to performance, scalability, and maintainability of AI-enhanced systems.




English (C!) required




Office: Brussels

modality of work: near-site




If interested, please apply!

Our personnel search is addressed to candidates of all genders.

The data will be processed and stored exclusively for the purposes of this or future selections, in compliance with the Federal Data Protection Law (LPD) and guaranteeing the rights referred to in art. 13 Legislative Decree 196/03 and EU regulation 679/2016 (GDPR)

Show more

  • Azure Synapse Analytics
  • Azure Data Lake Storage
  • Azure Databricks (nice to have)
  • Practical knowledge of Microsoft Fabric for data engineering and analytics scenarios.
  • Familiarity with Azure DevOps, including pipelines and automated deployment.


🔹 Data Science & AI

  • Solid practical experience in machine learning model development and deployment, including:
  • Supervised and unsupervised learning
  • Feature engineering and model evaluation
  • Experience with model integration into production systems/APIs
  • Strong Python programming skills, including:
  • Use of libraries like pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, matplotlib, TensorFlow or PyTorch (at least one)
  • Understanding of MLOps principles and lifecycle in Azure ML.


🔹 Data Integration & Engineering

  • Ability to connect and transform data from multiple sources using Azure services and APIs.
  • Experience working with structured and semi-structured data (SQL, JSON, XML).
  • Familiarity with data pipeline orchestration, performance tuning, and error handling.


🔹 Power BI & Visualization

  • Proficiency in Power BI, including:
  • Building dynamic dashboards
  • DAX expressions
  • DirectQuery vs Import models
  • Gateway setup and refresh optimization
  • Ability to translate analytical insights into business-friendly visualizations.


Additional Skills (Nice to Have)

  • Experience with OpenAI/ChatGPT or Azure OpenAI Services.
  • Knowledge of API architecture, RESTful APIs, and integrating AI models into API workflows.
  • Exposure to CI/CD pipelines and containerization (Docker/Kubernetes).
  • Microsoft certifications (e.g., Azure Data Scientist Associate, Power BI Data Analyst Associate).


Soft Skills

  • Strong problem-solving mindset and analytical skills.
  • Ability to work independently and within cross-functional Agile teams.
  • Clear communicator, capable of explaining complex models to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Attention to performance, scalability, and maintainability of AI-enhanced systems.


English (C!) required


Office: Brussels

modality of work: near-site


If interested, please apply!

Our personnel search is addressed to candidates of all genders.

  • The data will be processed and stored exclusively for the purposes of this or future selections, in compliance with the Federal Data Protection Law (LPD) and guaranteeing the rights referred to in art. 13 Legislative Decree 196/03 and EU regulation 679/2016 (GDPR)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Sibling is looking for a Data Scientist for a leading insurer in Brussels, Belgium. This will be a long-term freelance assignment.




Role




Designing, developing, and implementing AI/data-driven solutions tailored to business needs using internal and external data.
Extracting and communicating actionable insights to support decision-making and problem-solving.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify and address data-related challenges.
Continuously monitoring model accuracy and proactively identifying and fixing issues or data drifts.




Skills




At least 5 years of experience in data analysis, ideally within a commercial/business context.
Hands-on expertise in AI, GenAI, computer vision, NLP, and/or deep learning.
Advanced skills in Python, SQL, Power BI, and Databricks.
Excellent communication skills – you can clearly present complex data to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Fluency in French or Dutch, and English.
Hybrid Working

Title: Data Science and AI expert
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about using data science and AI to real-world problems? At Sopra Steria, we’re looking for an experienced and versatile professional to help lead the design and delivery of advanced analytics and AI solutions across a wide range of domainssuch as public services, utilities, healthcare, mobility, and beyond.

In this role, you will work on impactful projects from ideation to delivery. You’ll collaborate closely with both technical and business stakeholders transforming challenges into actionable insights and production-ready solutions. Whether it’s designing an optimization algorithm, building an LLM-based assistant, or delivering a forecasting pipeline, you’ll help clients unlock value from data.

We’re looking for someone who combines deep technical expertise with the maturity to take ownership, work autonomously, and guide teams and clients through the ever-evolving AI landscape.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries of digital transformation with AI. If you recognize yourself in most of the following, we’d love to talk:


You have at least 5 years of experience in delivering real-world AI and data science solutions in production environments.
You are proficient in Python and comfortable with frameworks like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
You have practical experience with machine learning, and ideally exposure to domains like natural language processing, computer vision, predictive analytics, LLM’s or optimization.
You’ve worked with at least one major cloud provider (Azure, AWS, or GCP), and understand how to bring models into production securely and efficiently.
You understand how to balance model performance with business relevance, and how to translate analytical outcomes into actionable results.
You enjoy working in a team, guiding junior colleagues, and collaborating with clients to define solution architectures and technical roadmaps.
You’re comfortable interacting with stakeholders and can communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively.
Experience in project ownership, technical leadership, or contributing to AI strategies.
You are fluent in English, and speak either Dutch or French.


What We Can Offer You


A key role in one of Europe’s leading digital transformation companies, where innovation meets real-world impact.
The opportunity to work on high-impact projects in AI and advanced analytics across industries and public institutions.
A culture of collaboration and continuous learning, supported by an expert network of consultants, architects, and engineers.
Access to our Sopra Steria Academy, with a wide range of training opportunities and certifications.
A hybrid and flexible working model, with access to offices across Belgium.
Career development opportunities both locally and internationally, within a growing Data & AI practice.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application! 

At OptimAI, we combine the best of both worlds: data science and supply chain optimization. You will be part of a forward-thinking team where you can shape the future of data science and supply chain management. This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference and grow your career in a field that is rapidly evolving and in high demand.

If you thrive on challenge, continuous learning, and want to make an impact in a fast-growing field, apply now to join the OptimAI Team.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models with a focus on generative AI (e.g., LLMs, diffusion models, GANs).
Apply generative AI for use cases such as text generation, summarization, classification, synthetic data creation, and intelligent assistants.
Collaborate with data engineers and ML engineers to build scalable pipelines.
Lead experimentation and validation of new GenAI models and tools.
Support prompt engineering and fine-tuning of foundation models where applicable.
Ensure compliance with data privacy, security, and ethical AI standards.
Present findings and models to stakeholders in clear, actionable formats.

Required Skills & Experience:

5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or ML Engineer.
Strong proficiency in Python and ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers, LangChain).
Deep knowledge of foundational models, LLMs (GPT, Claude, LLaMA, Mistral, etc.), and associated tooling.
Hands-on experience with fine-tuning or customizing generative AI models.
Solid grounding in classical ML (supervised/unsupervised learning), statistics, and NLP.
Familiarity with deploying models via REST APIs, Docker, and cloud services (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
Experience working with enterprise data in complex environments (structured/unstructured).
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences.

Nice to Have:

Experience with vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Weaviate).
Familiarity with GenAI enterprise platforms (e.g., OpenAI, Azure OpenAI, Cohere, Anthropic).
Experience in regulated industries (e.g., healthcare, finance, public sector).
Knowledge of European data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client’s needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client’s needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
data




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)…
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java …
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
(Medical R&D Sector – Confidential Client)




About the role




On behalf of one of our clients — a leading innovator in the medical research and development sector (Software and ML integrated Product)— we are recruiting for two open positions within the same dynamic R&D team:

Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Medior Machine Learning Engineer




This company is dedicated to improving healthcare outcomes through advanced statistical analysis and machine learning innovation. The ideal candidates will have a strong technical foundation, a passion for scientific research, and a deep interest in applying AI to solve meaningful real-world challenges in the healthcare domain.




Responsibilities

Research, design, and implement new machine learning models to enhance clinical data quality and support healthcare decision-making.
Continuously analyze scientific literature to identify promising algorithms and evaluate their practical application.
Produce robust, efficient Python code aligned with best software development practices.
Leverage open-source libraries and frameworks to drive experimentation and model optimization.
Apply best practices for experiment tracking, model validation, and deployment.
Explore new areas for machine learning applications in the medical and clinical research domain.
Actively contribute to scientific visibility through conferences, workshops, and potential publications.
Collaborate closely with data engineers, domain experts, and statisticians to bring prototypes into production.




Profile Sought

Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields.
Solid professional experience in machine learning, data science, or applied AI roles.
Excellent command of Python.
Practical experience with at least one deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Comfortable with Git and collaborative development workflows.
Proven ability to translate theoretical research into operational AI solutions.
Language requirements: Fluent English is sufficient; no other languages are required




Nice to Have

Experience with deep learning and natural language processing (NLP).
Practical experience with deployment and monitoring of machine learning models.
Previous exposure to medical data or work in highly regulated industries (healthcare, life sciences, etc.).
Knowledge of GPU computing environments.




Offer

Two open roles: one Senior and one Medior Machine Learning Engineer.
Remote-first working model: nearly fully remote; only 1 day/week minimum presence on-site South Brussels
Opportunity to work on scientifically impactful projects with real-world healthcare applications.
Competitive salary package including bonuses, mobility benefits, healthcare insurance, and more.
Dynamic, multicultural team environment focused on research excellence, technical innovation, and personal development.
Access to powerful computing infrastructure, learning materials, and career growth opportunities.

Title: Data Scientist (SNS01847)
Description:
Job Description

We’re looking for a data scientist (minimum 2+ years of experience) who is passionate about Natural Language Processing (NLP), Generative AI, and traditional machine learning and who knows how to ship high-impact, production-grade models.

Responsibility


Build and fine-tune traditional ML models (e.g., classification, regression, clustering) to support data-driven applications.
Create robust and scalable AI pipelines and APIs using Python and FastAPI.
Deploy models to production using AWS services such as ECS, Lambda, and S3, with attention to CI/CD, observability, and cost-effectiveness.
Think creatively and outside the box to explore new ML techniques, tools, or approaches that push the boundaries of what we can do.
Contribute to a culture of technical excellence and innovation in a fast-moving AI/ML team.


Qualifications


Minimum 2 years of industry experience in data science or machine learning.
Strong background in NLP, LLMs, and generative AI—comfortable with both the theory and tooling.
Familiarity with modern LLM stacks such as LangChain, LlamaIndex, CrewAI, or similar.

Python
APIs

Github

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
We are looking for a Software Engineer / Framework Developer to help us build a framework on top of Dagster, a modern data orchestration tool. This framework will support the automation of data workflows dedicated to training machine learning models, with a special emphasis on Digital Twin technologies.

You will be part of a technical team building scalable, maintainable architecture that can evolve alongside the rapid development of data and ML platforms.




Responsibilities:

Build and maintain a flexible framework on top of Dagster
Design modular and scalable components using modern Python design patterns
Develop and optimize data workflows to support machine learning training pipelines
Ensure code maintainability and adaptability to future Dagster changes
Contribute to clean and robust API design
Collaborate with technical stakeholders and engineering teams




Requirements:

Advanced Python programming experience
Solid understanding of software architecture and scalable framework design
Familiarity with data engineering workflows, ideally involving ML
Experience with or willingness to learn Dagster
Knowledge of API design principles and best practices
Ability to work independently and deliver in a dynamic, agile environment
Strong communication skills in English (written & verbal)

Software Engineer in Brussels, Belgium

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
As a collaborator in the Machine Learning team, you ensure the different predictive models and algorithms are running qualitatively and on time in the production environment also called the model factory. The mission of the machine learning engineer is key because this role makes the bridge between the products delivered by the Data Science team and the usage of the business.




The machine learning engineer will also cover some more technical missions as for example web scraping, POC’s concerning AI & Generative AI (in order to ensure a move to production for those POC’s).




The Machine Learning team is responsible for the quality of the models and as a consequence of the value created by the models that will be used by all the internal clients.




Your responsibilities:

Deploy large scale machine learning models and other scripts into production environment (in cloud and on-premise environments)
Review, optimize and simplify the code to ensure quality and reusability
Monitor the quality of input variables and the performances of the models’ outputs.
Contribute to parts of the ML pipeline, such as data preprocessing, feature selection, and model evaluation.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and product teams to integrate models into production.
Monitor model performance and updates models as needed
Solve well-defined machine learning problems and may work on smaller projects or parts of larger projects.
Apply existing algorithms and techniques to specific business problems




Specific expertise:

Expert understanding of git, experience with CI/CD pipelines;
Proficiency at Python and solid knowledge of at least one deep learning framework such as TensorFlow / Keras or PyTorch is a must.
Good knowledge of computational infrastructure;
Basic knowledge of Terraform;
Knowledge of machine learning techniques, general deep learning, predictive modelling and Generative AI in order to be able to challenge the inputs and the outputs produced by the Data Science team
Understanding of Google Cloud Platform, ML Ops principles and software development tools/best practices;
Expertise in Data Ingestion / Processing and Modelling: you are able to express complex data needs and understand data quality-cleansing processes & methods
Extensive Corporate Data Knowledge: aware of critical company business processes and underlying data, you are able to challenge data quality
Fluency in SQL for writing efficient queries on large datasets
Good knowledge of Linux operating system
Ability to write robust code in Python, R and Java
Good to have: good knowledge of networking, multiprocessing, parallel computing and real-time computations;
Should be able to challenge the inputs and outputs of AI and Gen AI products as well as the way it was built.




Your profile:

Master's degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics) or equivalent work experience. with 2-5 years of experience in machine learning or related fields
Proficient in key machine learning tools and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Analytical thinking and self-learning spirit
Strong programming and data analytics skills
Able to work and collaborate transversally
Good communication and presentation skills (vulgarisation)
Collaboration skills (with other data scientists, data engineers and other teams)
Capacity to influence and engage, assertiveness and being diplomatic
Customer-oriented and pragmatic
Stress resistant
Fluent English and fluent French or Dutch




Our offer:

You will make the difference in this highly innovative vibe. As a result, you will develop your full potential by working with highly skilled colleagues and through continuous training. Moreover, you can count on a highly competitive and versatile compensation (market competitive salary, company car or legal mobility budget, homeworking and net allowance, performance bonus, meal vouchers) and benefits package.




Inspired? Please send us your resume and we will rapidly get back to you to invite you for further interviews.

Title: AI Scientist
Description:
Purpose

The AI Scientist at Keytrade Bank is a critical role in leveraging the potential of artificial intelligence to drive innovation, efficiency, and compliance within the bank. This individual will design, develop, and maintain AI systems while addressing governance, compliance, and ethical considerations. They will also enhance existing AI products and integrate advanced cloud-based technologies, ensuring Keytrade Bank remains a leader in the responsible and effective use of AI within the financial sector.







Reporting Line

The AI Scientist will report to the AI Innovation Lead and collaborate closely with the data feature team.







Responsibilities

Design, implement and test AI models to enhance decision-making, customer experiences, and operational efficiencies.
Maintain, optimize and test existing AI solutions, ensuring they adapt to emerging technologies and evolving business needs.
Collaborate with teams to integrate AI systems with UI technologies, such as Mendix, to enhance usability and functionality.
Implement and enhance MLOps/DevOps best practices for streamlined development, deployment, and monitoring of AI solutions.
Ensure responsible and ethical use of AI at Keytrade Bank, following guidelines of EU regulations (EU AI Act, GDPR…)
Help in establishing policies to govern the lifecycle of AI models, including accountability, fairness, and transparency.
Work with cross-functional teams to embed governance practices into the deployment of AI systems.
Collaborate with internal security and risk teams to assess and mitigate AI-related risks.
Stay informed about emerging trends in AI and cloud computing to recommend innovative solutions.
Translate technical AI concepts into actionable insights for stakeholders, including non-technical teams.
Support product teams in implementing AI-driven solutions and aligning them with business objectives.
Provide insights on AI products, data and AI governance, and emerging technology trends to colleagues and stakeholders through targeted workshops and “lunch and learn” sessions.
Participate in training sessions, conferences, and industry events to enhance professional growth.
Provide training sessions as trainer in our data & AI Academy.




Skills and Requirements

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and familiarity with machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlo
w).Experience with cloud technologies (Azure or AW
S).Proficiency in MLOps/DevOps best practices, including CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and monitoring too
ls.Ability to manage AI and analytics projects with clear deliverables and KP
Is.Experience in AGILE development and cross-department collaborati
on.Excellent communication skills to present AI insights to diverse stakeholde
rs.Familiarity with UI/UX design principles and tools like Mendix for integrating AI products into customer-facing applicatio
ns.Knowledge of financial regulations affecting AI, including the EU AI Act, GDPR and other data protection laws.




Preferred attitude

Curiosity, humility and critical thinking
Problem-solving mindset and willingness to adapt to new challenges
Proactive, ethical, pragmatic and customer-focussed
Result-oriented with a strong focus on delivering high-quality outcomes for assigned tasks




Education and Experience

Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related fi

eld.2–6 years of experience in AI or data science roles, preferably within the banking or financial industry.




Our Offer

A 100 % Belgian contract in Brussels.
Keytrade Bank is a young and dynamic organization with a lean structure, that evolves in an Agile ecosystem. The tempo and the atmosphere are upbeat and no day goes by without an element of fun!
The company works in an agile setup with a lot of flexibility regarding remote work. This means that you will be guaranteed at least 50% homework with a high degree of flexibility.
Offices are in Watermael-Boitsfort in a peaceful, green surrounding.
A competitive salary with extra-legal advantages such as meal vouchers, group insurance, health insurance and many other.
Continued education and access to trainings.
Stepping stone for a continued career within Keytrade Bank.
Open, inclusive culture and dynamic working environment.

Title: AI and ML Specialist
Description:
Fincons Group is an IT business consulting company that has been designing the digital future of leading companies on international markets for 40 years. Fincons Group built its reputation on foreseeing and interpreting new business models and the rapid evolution of IT systems by building a complete range of services: from research and consulting to design and development, from system integration of leading vendor software solutions right up to application management, supporting clients step by step along their digital transformation journey. Fincons is a multinational with over 2,600 people and several offices worldwide (in Italy, Switzerland, Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Belgium and the USA), but above all a Family Company where the founders play a strategic role with commitment and passion, grounding the company in the same principles of a united and caring family.

We firmly believe in the value of cooperation and in the contribution that every idea and intuition can bring. We believe that everyone’s effort can make a difference. Transforming knowledge into a strategic resource is our company mission, and we pursue it with the help of our most strategic asset: our people.




Fincons is looking for a AI & ML Specialist




We are looking for a highly skilled AI/ML Specialist with practical experience in designing, implementing, and deploying machine learning models and large language models (LLMs) within the Microsoft Azure ecosystem. The candidate will support the enhancement of existing systems and APIs by integrating AI-driven solutions, leveraging platforms such as Azure Machine Learning, Microsoft Fabric, and Power BI for intelligent analytics and automation.




🔹 AI & Machine Learning

Strong hands-on experience with:
Supervised and unsupervised learning
Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Large Language Models (LLMs)
Prompt engineering, fine-tuning, or deployment of models like GPT, T5, or BERT
Proficiency in Python and ML libraries/frameworks:
scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow, PyTorch, transformers, spaCy
Experience with model lifecycle management and MLOps practices.

🔹 Microsoft Azure Ecosystem

Advanced experience with:
Azure Machine Learning (model training, tracking, deployment)
Azure OpenAI Services (GPT models, embeddings, cognitive services)
Azure Functions, Azure API Management, and Azure Logic Apps
Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Data Lake, and Databricks
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric for managing AI-infused data products.

🔹 API & System Integration

Experience integrating ML/LLM models into APIs and enterprise systems.
Strong understanding of RESTful APIs, webhooks, and JSON.
Able to design and expose models as scalable, secure endpoints.

🔹 Power BI & Analytics

Working knowledge of Power BI, particularly for:
Visualizing model outputs and predictions
Creating AI-augmented reports and dashboards
Ability to collaborate with BI teams to align model insights with business KPIs.




Additional Skills (Nice to Have)

Experience with CI/CD for ML (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions)
Familiarity with Responsible AI, data privacy, and explainability
Understanding of vector databases and embedding-based search
Exposure to semantic search, chatbot development, and AI assistants




Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and critical thinking capabilities
Clear communicator with the ability to present complex AI topics to non-technical stakeholders
Agile mindset; comfortable in fast-paced, evolving environments
Collaborative and proactive attitude in cross-functional teams




Certifications (Preferred)

Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate
Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Scientist Associate










English (C1) required




Office: Brussels

modality of work: near-site




If interested, please apply!

Our personnel search is addressed to candidates of all genders.

The data will be processed and stored exclusively for the purposes of this or future selections, in compliance with the Federal Data Protection Law (LPD) and guaranteeing the rights referred to in art. 13 Legislative Decree 196/03 and EU regulation 679/2016 (GDPR)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are seeking a talented and passionate Data Scientist to join our client team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for extracting valuable insights from complex datasets, building predictive models, and contributing to data-driven decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to solve challenging business problems and drive innovation.




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement machine learning models using Python libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
Perform data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering to prepare data for analysis.
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify patterns and trends in data.
Visualize data using libraries like Matplotlib and Seaborn to communicate findings effectively.
Collaborate with engineers and product managers to deploy and monitor machine learning models.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning.
Communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Scientist or similar role.
Strong proficiency in Python and relevant libraries (scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy, etc.).
Experience with machine learning algorithms and techniques (regression, classification, clustering, etc.).
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methods.
Experience with data visualization tools and libraries.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Experience with SQL and databases.
Experience with Cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Experience with Big Data technologies like Spark or Hadoop.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Experience with natural language processing (NLP).
Experience with time series analysis.
Experience with A/B testing.




Other information:

Location: Hungary or Bulgaria

Work Mode: 100% Remote

Contract type: B2B/Freelance

Contract: 6 months (Possibility of extension)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Jouw rol is het analyseren en interpreteren van complexe datasets met behulp van AI en machine learning technieken, en deze om te zetten in technische oplossingen om op die manier het gewenste eindresultaat voor de klant te produceren.

Je analyseert grote datasets om trends, patronen en inzichten te ontdekken.

Je ontwikkelt en implementeert machine learning modellen om voorspellingen te doen of beslissingen te automatiseren.

Je neemt ook deel in de ontwikkeling van nieuwe machine learning modellen en prototypes en evalueert deze met de data analisten.

Je communiceert bevindingen en aanbevelingen aan belanghebbenden, vaak door middel van visualisaties en presentaties.




Skills

Je bent pas afgestudeerd of hebt al ervaring, en beschikt over een masterdiploma in IT, Science (zoals wiskunde of fysica), of bent burgerlijk of industrieel ingenieur.
Je hebt kennis van R, Python (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy), Exploratory Data Analysis.
Je hebt een affiniteit voor verschillende machine learning-algoritmen, zoals regressie, classificatie, clustering en deep learning.
Een eerste ervaring met Matplotlib, Seaborn, of Tableau en met big data technologieën (Hadoop, Spark of NoSQL databases) is een plus.
Je bent vertrouwd met databases en query-talen zoals SQL om gegevens efficiënt te kunnen opslaan en ophalen.
Je spreekt Nederlands en je kunt je vloeiend uitdrukken in het Engels.
