Title: Data Scientist II - Agriculture Analytics (Machine Learning / Geospatial)
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You’ll work with McKinsey’s agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics – generally predictive or geospatial in nature – to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact – redefining what it means to provide the “best of the firm” to our clients.

Your Impact

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE’s core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients’ most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call “IP development”) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Willingness to travel up to 50%
Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred
Show more
HTML:
Who You'll Work With

You’ll work with McKinsey’s agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics – generally predictive or geospatial in nature – to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact – redefining what it means to provide the “best of the firm” to our clients.

Your Impact

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE’s core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients’ most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call “IP development”) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

Your Qualifications and Skills

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
  • Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
  • Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
  • Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
  • Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
  • Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
  • Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
  • Strong interpersonal communication skills
  • Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
  • Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
  • Willingness to travel up to 50%
  • Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.




Who We Are

At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users’ privacy.

By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.

Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We’re fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.

If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.




Your Challenge

As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client’s advertising KPIs.
You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.




Our core values

Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.

Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.

We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.

We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.




Tech Stack

We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.

In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.




What You’ll Need to Succeed

You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.




Why Join Seedtag?

Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks

Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K€ (external screen, chair, table...)
Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
Macbook Pro M3




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let’s grow together!




At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Join Our Team as a Data Scientist in the thriving iGaming Industry! 🚀




🧩Who we are?

Ludicrum is redefining iGaming, blending creativity with technology to deliver world-class gaming experiences. From marketing and product development to customer support and financial reporting, our teams are changing the game. Our vision is to create ultra-intuitive and engaging platforms to fuel growth through strategic partnerships and market expansion.

Our success is driven by core values deeply embedded in our culture. We believe in transparency, always being clear, open, and honest. We are goal-focused, relentlessly pursuing our targets. Adaptability is key—we embrace change and use it to excel. Kaizen guides us, as we continuously improve, test, and refine.

With a dynamic and collaborative culture and fast career growth, our 250+ global team thrives!




🥜 In a nutshell

As a Data Scientist, you will turn complex data into impactful insights through statistical analysis, machine learning models, and experimental design. Your work will inform key decisions across product, marketing, and operations—helping us uncover player behavior, improve retention, and scale smartly.




🎯 The responsibilities & the impact YOU will have:

Analyze large structured and unstructured datasets to identify trends and generate actionable insights.
Build and deploy machine learning models for forecasting, classification, and recommendation use cases.
Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to translate business problems into analytical solutions.
Design and run A/B tests and other experiments to measure the impact of product or process changes.
Create clear dashboards and visualizations that effectively communicate results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data quality and pipeline reliability.
Maintain thorough documentation of code, models, methodologies, and assumptions.
Stay current on emerging tools, techniques, and best practices in data science.




⚡ All you need is…

Minimum 2 years of experience as a Data Scientist or similar analytical role, with strong command of SQL and experience working with large datasets.
Proficiency in Python (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn) or R for data analysis and building predictive models.
Hands-on experience with statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and A/B testing methodologies.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Oracle BI, and ability to present insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Solid grasp of experimental design and a structured approach to validating data-driven decisions.
Working knowledge of version control tools like Git and collaboration across cross-functional teams.

Nice to have

Familiarity with streaming data tools like Apache Kafka or Spark Streaming.
Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines and reproducible workflows.
Experience with distributed systems and working with large-scale datasets.
Proficiency with Oracle BI for dashboards and reporting.
Comfort using Jira for task and project tracking.




🌟 Why You’ll love working here:

Flexible and Remote Working: Work from anywhere, supporting your work-life balance.
Career Growth: We’re committed to your development, offering training and advancement opportunities.
Performance Bonuses: Earn bonuses based on company and personal performance.
Health and Fitness Benefits: Receive fitness reimbursements from day one, and after one year of employment, gain access to a health budget to support your well-being.
Extra Paid Annual Leave: Enjoy 22 days of vacation, with an additional day added for each year of employment, up to a maximum of 26 days.
Special Birthday Perk: Take your birthday off after a year of employment to celebrate!




We are not just offering a job; we offer the chance to be part of something bigger. Apply today! Submit your resume in English and join us in creating unforgettable experiences. We can’t wait to hear from you!

Title: Expert in AI /NLP/ ML
HTML:
📌 Expert in AI /NLP/ ML

We are looking for an Expert in AI /NLP/ ML who will integrate the IT team., for a major European institution.

🛠 Your Responsibilities:

  • Design and implementation of AI solutions at REGIO in close collaboration with team management and AI technical lead;
  • Propose or support adequate machine learning models and employ NLP techniques to extract valuable insights from large datasets;
  • Support the development of generative AI solutions in knowledge management;
  • Engage with colleagues from various teams, analyze business requirements and translate them into AI solutions;
  • Follow AI developments within the European Commission. Attend meetings on AI and prepare briefings for the management.

✅ Required Skills & Experience:

  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in developing AI solutions, including machine learning and NLP; Proven experience with Deep Learning models, NLP techniques, NLTK, ;
  • Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • Experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud);
  • Ability to adapt to evolving technologies and methodologies in AI;
  • Experience in cleaning and preparing data for AI/ML models;
  • Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g. Docker) for the deployment of AI and machine learning applications. Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset;
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (Git Hub) and ETL tools (e.g. dbt, Airflow);
  • Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation;
  • Solution-oriented and accuracy to detail;
  • Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application developments;
  • Knowledge of European Commission IT environment is an asset.

🎯 Specific expertise:

  • Minimum 3 years experience and expertise in the command of Python, R , MongoDB, C++, Matlab, Atlassian with specific hands-on experience linked to relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, SpaCy, NLTK, PyTorch, TensorFlow, dplyr, stringr, tidymodels, torch for R, ggplot.
  • Minimum 1 year experience (expertise) of Semantic NLP techniques, including semantic representation, text splitting, analysis, similarity and parsing.

Minimum 2 years of hands-on knowledge with Large Language Models (e.g. OpenAI, LLaMa and Mistal) and recent handson experience on using LangChain framework, Hugging Face (in NLP context), hybridsearch and streamlit

  • Outstanding communication skills and ability to deliver presentation to both business and technical audiences;
  • Excellent command of English (see certification requirements below)
  • French and/or German at conversational level or attested through academic studies in either France or Germany;

🎯Certifications:

  • Level of education corresponding to Level 7 of the European Qualification Framework which typically corresponds to a master degree of 5 years.

Benefits:

✅ Remote model of work from Belgium.

🤝 Long-term Freelance project.

🌍 Participate on a multicultural and collaborative team, with clear processes and a focus on a major European institution.

Be part of the EU’s digital future.

Apply now to help shape high-impact solutions!

Title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning / NLP Expert
HTML:
Twenty8 is an independent firm delivering IT services to international organizations, with a focus on supporting digital transformation, business development, and customer-centric solutions.

We collaborate closely with European Union public institutions and agencies, helping skilled professionals navigate and grow in their international careers.


We are currently seeking an experienced Data Scientist/Machine Learning/NLP Expert to support a prestigious European Institution in Brussels. 🔍🇪🇺


🖥️ KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solutions;
  • Development and maintenance of software applications in the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI);
  • Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations;
  • Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions);
  • Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.


📝 REQUIREMENTS:


  • 12+ years of experience in IT or a relevant field;
  • University degree in Computer Science/IT/Engineering;
  • C1/C2 level of English (French B1+ preferred);
  • Excellent knowledge of Python, Matlab, R and its NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy/NLTK/scikit-learn/pandas);
  • Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms (k-NN/Naive Bayes/SVM/Decision Forests/Neural Network) and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • Excellent knowledge of Data Management;
  • Good knowledge of AWS and/or Azure;
  • Good knowledge of the Linux environment;
  • Knowledge of NoSQL databases (MongoDB/Cassandra/HBase) and data visualization tools (D3.js/GGplot).


This is a hybrid role, requiring on-site presence at the Brussels office just one day per week. 📍


Ready to Apply?

If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you!

Submit your CV today and embark on an exciting journey with us! 📩

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Do you want to be part of a company that’s transforming healthcare?




Lyfegen helps bridge the gap to faster, smarter access with pricing, access, and rebate management solutions. Our platform is used by health insurers, governments, hospital payers, and pharmaceutical companies worldwide to simplify the complexities of drug pricing agreements, optimize rebates, and drive better value.




As a global leader in drug access and rebate management, Lyfegen is expanding its reach and impact. As we continue to scale, we’re looking for passionate professionals to join us and help shape the future of healthcare.




We’re looking for an AI Engineer to play a key role in shaping our solutions. In this role, you will be leading and driving AI initiatives, optimizing simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology— all to align business goals with technical capabilities.




At Lyfegen, we’re tackling challenges no one has solved before. That’s why we are looking for problem solvers with a proactive mindset—people who thrive on turning complexity into opportunity.




Join us and help bridge the gap to faster and smarter access to medicines for patients.




Your main responsibilities:

Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.




Who you are:

Machine learning and NLP expertise:
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms such as gradient boosted trees.
Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and LangChain.







What we offer:

Join a company that improves access to healthcare for patients.
Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
The possibility to work flexibly.
Become part of a team of international high performers.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Experience an attractive and competitive compensation package aligned with the dynamic nature of a scale-up start-up.
Show more
HTML:
Do you want to be part of a company that’s transforming healthcare?


Lyfegen helps bridge the gap to faster, smarter access with pricing, access, and rebate management solutions. Our platform is used by health insurers, governments, hospital payers, and pharmaceutical companies worldwide to simplify the complexities of drug pricing agreements, optimize rebates, and drive better value.


As a global leader in drug access and rebate management, Lyfegen is expanding its reach and impact. As we continue to scale, we’re looking for passionate professionals to join us and help shape the future of healthcare.


We’re looking for an AI Engineer to play a key role in shaping our solutions. In this role, you will be leading and driving AI initiatives, optimizing simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology— all to align business goals with technical capabilities.


At Lyfegen, we’re tackling challenges no one has solved before. That’s why we are looking for problem solvers with a proactive mindset—people who thrive on turning complexity into opportunity.


Join us and help bridge the gap to faster and smarter access to medicines for patients.


Your main responsibilities:

  • Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
  • Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
  • Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
  • Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
  • Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.


Who you are:

  • Machine learning and NLP expertise:
  • Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms such as gradient boosted trees.
  • Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
  • Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
  • Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and LangChain.



What we offer:

  • Join a company that improves access to healthcare for patients.
  • Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
  • The possibility to work flexibly.
  • Become part of a team of international high performers.
  • Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
  • Experience an attractive and competitive compensation package aligned with the dynamic nature of a scale-up start-up.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA’s Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve ideeën uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken?




Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‘business-as-usual’ proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het “ACA Innovation Lab” zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe ideeën en technologieën af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)?




Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, …)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?




Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt ervaring als tech lead in een nieuwe start-up omgeving.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig te werk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?




Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We’ve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega’s gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
ML Ops Engineer – Remote Contract (Europe-Based)




We are currently seeking an experienced ML Ops Engineer for a remote contract role lasting until the end of the year. You will play a key role in building and scaling machine learning infrastructure to support model training and deployment across global teams.




This role is focused on developing robust, production-grade ML infrastructure, enabling seamless workflows from experimentation to deployment. Ideal for professionals with strong experience in ML Ops, Python, and cloud technologies—not just building pipelines, but establishing infrastructure at scale.




Key Responsibilities:

Build and scale ML infrastructure across global teams
Enable the training and deployment of machine learning models
Design robust, reproducible workflows across the ML lifecycle
Ensure performance, scalability, and compliance across environments
Support collaboration with distributed teams through shared tooling




Required Experience:

Strong hands-on experience with AWS
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, scikit-learn)
Solid understanding of Kubernetes, CI/CD, and ML Ops best practices
Experience working with distributed teams and secure data environments
Strong communication skills and fluency in English




Nice to Have:

Experience with MLflow, Airflow, and Terraform
Familiarity with optimizing compute and storage resources at scale




This is a remote position open to candidates based in Europe. Start is immediate and the project runs through to December 2025.




If you're an experienced ML Ops Engineer looking to contribute to a high-impact project in a fully remote setting, we'd love to hear from you.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Job Title: AI Engineer




Location: Remote




My client at the forefront of AI innovation, working on groundbreaking projects that push the limits of what artificial intelligence can achieve. We are looking for a skilled Generative AI Engineer to join our dynamic team and help us develop cutting-edge AI models using TensorFlow and PyTorch.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and optimize AI models.
Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to integrate models into real-world applications.
Develop and maintain TensorFlow and PyTorch-based solutions.
Experiment with and enhance current generative models to improve accuracy and performance.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI research and best practices.




Required Skills & Experience:

Proficiency in TensorFlow and PyTorch.
Strong background in machine learning, deep learning, and neural networks.
Experience with generative models
Solid programming skills in Python.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Familiarity with cloud-based platforms is a plus.




🔗 Apply now or message me directly for more details about the role!

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
HTML:
Role: Semantic AI Expert


Location: Remote


Your Tasks:

  • Support activities related to integrating AI into Semantic Interoperability through various initiatives , focusing on exploration and proposing production solutions, particularly regarding agentic AI;
  • Support the SEMIC support to EU policies, and provide technical support for Interoperability Assessment data modelling activities, SDGR/OOTS, and interoperability in Data Spaces;
  • Provide support on the SEMIC toolchain, with benchmarking, and identifying open-source solutions to support data modelling activities;
  • Support the formalisation, integration, and Member States adoption of Linked Data Event Streams (LDES) as a SEMIC specification, ensuring alignment with existing standards and EU data strategies;
  • Assist in the continuous improvement and implementation support for DCAT-AP, including providing guidance to Data paces on adopting the profile and assist in creating additional sub-profiles where necessary;
  • Be actively involved in the creation of blog post publications on modelling approaches and practices;
  • Involvement in organisation and implementation of SEMIC webinars and workshops.


Requirements

  • Master’s degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Information and Communication Technologies, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Minimum 8 years experience in Semantic methodologies, Semantic transformation, Metadata modelling, Linked data;
  • Minimum 8 years experience in OWL, RDF, SKOS, XML, shacl;
  • Proven work experience with machine learning and AI models in particular new trends working on agents;
  • Excellent command of the English language.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
ML Engineer (Remote, EU-based | 12-Month Contract | $5,500/month B2B)




Location: Remote (candidates must be EU-based)




Compensation: Up to $5,500/month gross (B2B)




Perks: 29 days paid holiday




Job Purpose

We're looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with a strong MLOps background to build and maintain automated ML systems from training pipelines to production inference services. You'll work closely with data scientists and engineers to deliver scalable, efficient, and reliable ML infrastructure, fostering a culture of shared ownership and high performance.




Key Responsibilities

Design and manage MLOps systems for end-to-end ML workflows.
Build and optimize training pipelines and production inference services.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions.
Implement best practices for model versioning, monitoring, and deployment.
Support on-call rotations to ensure system reliability.




Experience & Qualifications

Proficient in containerization/microservices (e.g., Docker) and CI/CD integration.
Strong experience in automating ML pipelines and monitoring performance.
Skilled in model serving (e.g., TensorFlow Serving, TorchServe) and experiment tracking.
Advanced Python skills; familiar with NumPy, pandas, PyTorch, TensorFlow.
Experience with AWS services (EC2, S3, EKS) and MLOps tools (Kubeflow, MLflow, FastAPI).
Familiar with big data tools like Apache Spark and optimizing Spark jobs.
Strong grasp of software engineering best practices (version control, testing, code reviews).
Proven ability to design scalable training workflows and low-latency inference systems.
Comfortable configuring Kubeflow Pipelines for training and deployment.
Self-starter with strong problem-solving and prioritization skills.
Advanced English proficiency.




Nice to Have

FastAPI: Experience building lightweight REST APIs.
Terraform: Understanding of IaC and cloud resource automation.
Kubernetes: Basic knowledge of container orchestration and resource management.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
CluePoints is a fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Quality Management and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products utilize advanced statistical and machine learning algorithms to assess the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. At CluePoints, we are looking for people with fresh ideas to keep developing our algorithms and help us to sustain our growth.




Responsibilities

As a member of our Research team:

You develop new machine learning models to enhance the CluePoints web platform and/or to develop new products.
You identify promising ML techniques from scientific literature and assess their viability
You leverage relevant open-source resources and keep yourself up-to-date to new developments in this area
You produce robust and clean python code
You follow ML best practices to keep track of experiments and models
You identify new fields of applications for machine learning and deep learning within CluePoints and contribute to increased adoption of machine learning within the healthcare industry
You stay on the edge of relevant research and help CluePoints to continue increasing its scientific visibility by participating at scientific conferences and publishing in scientific journals




Main Qualifications

Master or PhD in Computer sciences or quantitative fields (maths, physics, ...)
Professional experience in machine learning / data science
Efficient in Python
Good knowledge in at least one deep learning platform like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with deep learning and natural language Processing
Experience in supporting deployments of machine learning models
Experience with medical data
Experience in GPU computing




Top reasons to work with us:

Flexibility is part of our DNA and you’ll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or choose to come to the office any day (please note that this point only concerns employees located in our office in Belgium).
If you choose to come to the office, you’ll discover a fun atmosphere including a game room (e.g., withkicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard).
Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more!
You’ll be working within a squad organization offering you ownership on projects, and utilize high quality equipment like powerful laptops and screens.
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards!
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program.
Show more

Title: Data Science Manager
Description:
In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.




What is the job about?

Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutionsGathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…




Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:

Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.




We offer

As a certified Top Employer we offer:

An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.

Show more

  • Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
  • Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist
  • IT profiles
  • Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…


Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:

  • Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
  • A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
  • Other types of eduction are also valued.
  • A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
  • Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
  • Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
  • The desire to learn and grow
  • A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
  • Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.


We offer

As a certified Top Employer we offer:

  • An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
  • A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
  • Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
  • Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
  • Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
  • A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
  • A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
  • Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
  • An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
For an Insurance company, we are looking for a talented AI data scientist with a business mindset coupled with a strong expertise in (Gen)AI. The successful candidate will work in a dynamic environment that presents opportunities to apply analytical skills to solve business problems.




About the Role

The successful candidate will work in a dynamic environment that presents opportunities to apply analytical skills to solve business problems.




Responsibilities

Work closely with business and technical teams to identify high-impact use cases for Generative AI
Design, develop, and implement AI driven solutions for business needs, using both internal and external data sources.
Identify and communicate insights from data analysis to support decision-making and problem solving activities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve data-related issues.
Continuously monitor AI models for accuracy, and proactively identify and resolve data discrepancies and drift.
Contribute to the development of a GenAI capability framework and internal best practices.




Qualifications

Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business) or a related field with a strong focus on data analysis.




Required Skills

Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Manage multiple priorities
Meet tight deadlines
Availability for occasional travel and projects in other operating companies
Proven experience with data wrangling, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and machine learning.
Proficient in Python and commonly used libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, etc.).
Strong knowledge of cloud platforms, especially Azure (Azure AI services, Azure ML, Vertex AI, Databricks, Azure OpenAI, etc.)
Deep expertise with Python libraries such as Langchain, LangGraph, Promptflow, Semantic Kernel, and Autogen.
Deep understanding of LLMs fine-tuning and/or training lifecycle (LLMops).
Proven experience in deploying and monitoring Gen AI models using CI/CD pipelines, Weight & Biases, and GitHub workflows.




Preferred Skills

Strong business acumen and the ability to understand and communicate business needs and requirements.
Data science, preferably in a business setting.







Start date & duration

Expected Start date: Asap

Duration: 24 months (Depending on project evolution, extension is possible)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Scorewarrior.

We're a game developer and publisher from Cyprus with one single game in the 4x strategy genre: Total Battle. We're a one-game company on purpose, because in everything we do, we focus

We are currently concentrating on two major goals:

To make our game #1 in its genre.
To make our company the best place to work on games.

And we're far from there; we still have a lot of work to do.

That's why we need you.




Let's dive in.

As our marketing Data Scientist you will play a key role in optimizing our marketing strategies by providing meaningful insights through advanced modeling. Your primary focus will be to build predictive models that forecast user payment behavior by Day30, based on in-game activity data collected during the first 7 days of a user’s lifetime.




Key responsibilities.

Build and refine predictive models to forecast users payment likelihood.
Explore and process large volumes of in-game event data to uncover patterns relevant for forecasting.
Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure that the models drive better user acquisition decisions.
Effectively manage large datasets, ensuring timely and precise insights.




You could be a great fit for this position If:

You have at least 4 years of experience in data science and 2+ years in gaming industry.
You have a proven track record in creating and implementing predictive models related to customer behavior.
You possess strong Python skills and experience with key machine learning libraries (scikit-learn, pandas, numpy, XGBoost, LightGBM, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
You have experience working with large datasets and are capable of effectively diving deep into detailed analyses.
You excel at translating complex analytical concepts into clear insights and recommendations for stakeholders across all levels.
You love game development.
Your English is B1 and higher, your Russian is B2 and higher.




IMPORTANT: this role is a 6 months project.




Do you accept the challenge?

Apply today!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist (Python Programming)
Description:
We are hiring a highly organized and detail oriented senior Data Scientist to support the industrialization of existing scripts, as well as the inclusion of new functionalities & a full migration to Python. The ideal candidate would be responsible for the full development process, including efficient programming, discussing functionalities with business experts, maintaining code & user documentation, all while ensuring a timely completion of the deliverables.

Responsibilities


Development of an industrialized full-Python tool from requirements & first-generation script.
A refactoring of the scripts to distinguish the parts that must run within Digsilent Powerfactory or not.
Efficient programming to improve readability & performance, while coping with vast amounts of data.
Modular programming to anticipate future functionalities.
The inclusion of completeness verifications for input data.
The development of additional functionalities in close collaboration with the business experts, to limit manual pre-processing of the input data.
The creation of clear & maintainable documentation for the developed tool.


The following competencies are required for this position


Python programming language experience
Efficient programming, to cope with vast amounts of data
Modular programming, adaptable to changing needs
Profiling and optimization of scripts
Code documentation


Requirements:


At least 5 years' experience in Python programming
Fluency in English (spoken & written) as well as Dutch and/or French
Basic knowledge of electricity or electric power systems (Grid structure, localization of electrical generation and consumption, etc.) is a plus.
Ability to handle vast amounts of data in an efficient manner
Well-organized and attention to details,
Fluent communication and coordination,
Autonomous and capable to manage & respect deadlines,
Strong analytical & problem-solving skills: ability to analyze, interpret and utilize data effectively for their desired purposes.

Title: Young Professional AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about Data Science and AI? As a Young Professional AI Engineer, you’ll be part of OptimAI, a dynamic team that drives innovation in the world of data science and supply chain management through cutting-edge technologies and data-driven solutions.

You’ll join a highly collaborative team working on exciting and impactful projects focused on leveraging data science techniques to solve complex problems. Using agile methodologies, you will support the development of smart, innovative solutions for our clients, helping them navigate AI challenges and drive their digital transformation.

As part of the OptimAI Team, you will:


Contribute to the technical design and implementation of data science and AI solutions.
Work with state-of-the-art tools and techniques in data analysis, machine learning, optimization models, and predictive analytics.
Play an active role in analyzing large datasets, identifying trends, and creating actionable insights.
Collaborate with internal experts and clients to develop tailored solutions and ensure successful project execution.


Qualifications

Skills & Experience We’re Looking For:


A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or a related field.
Practical experience or strong interest in applying data science techniques such as machine learning, statistical modeling.
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, and experience with tools like Pandas, TensorFlow, or scikit-learn is a plus.
Exposure to optimization algorithms (e.g., linear programming, heuristic methods) is highly desirable.
You're fluent in Dutch or French, have a strong grasp of the other, and speak English fluently as well.


What We Offer You:


A comprehensive training program with access to the Sopra Steria Academy, focused on both technical and personal development.
The opportunity to work with leading experts in data science and AI.
Access to over 250 training courses, specialized certifications, and coaching sessions to fast-track your professional growth.
Exposure to challenging and impactful projects with international clients across various industries.
A competitive salary, company car lease or mobility budget, laptop, smartphone, and other benefits like insurance, meal vouchers, and monthly office drinks.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!   

At OptimAI, we combine the best of both worlds: data science and supply chain optimization. You will be part of a forward-thinking team where you can shape the future of data science and supply chain management. This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference and grow your career in a field that is rapidly evolving and in high demand.

If you thrive on challenge, continuous learning, and want to make an impact in a fast-growing field, apply now to join the OptimAI Team.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (AI/ML Focus)
Description:
Description

We're a global IT consulting company and a software development service provider that helps organizations operate at their best. With 30+ years of experience, +6 Global locations, and +1000 employees, TEAM combines technology expertise, valuable insights, business intelligence, and a client-centered approach to address challenges in business operations, digital transformation, risk management, compliance, business continuity, and more.




The client is implementing a new system for anti-money laundering in 30 of their subsidiaries around the world.

The technical part of the project involves assessment of the source data in each country and statistical modelling to set up the new system: segmentation of customers and parametrization of detection scenarios.




Profile requirements:

At least a bachelor's degree in data science or a similar field
At least 12 years of experience with development of machine learning or AI models
Good understanding of machine learning algorithms for classification and clustering
Experience with analysis or processing of financial transactions
Python, Spark and Git
Outstanding English both verbal and written
Experience in the field of anti-financial crime or banking is a plus




Desired Skills

Git

Pyspark

Python




What We Offer

Being a part of TEAM International gives you the chance to work on challenging projects with great professionals, international clients, and the latest technologies.

Flexible engagement models.
Work alongside top IT global talent.
Full compliance with security and regulatory standards.
Customized IT and software development solutions.
A supportive and collaborative work environment.

Title: Data Scientist Energy and Utilities
Description:
Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.




 Your journey with us

Work in cross-functional teams to define and develop analytical solution for our clients, across industries.
Work on the full end-to-end modelling pipeline, from data gathering, exploration and feature engineering, to machine learning model development and deployment.
Translate data analysis results into actionable insights, and present them to project stakeholders.
Contribute to the development of our business by taking ownership of your work, transferring lessons learned to the team and proactively looking for opportunities to improve and evolve our offerings and services.
You will continuously evolve, developing and providing different types of Risk Analytics services at our clients.
You will learn new technologies, discuss them with business stakeholders and implement them at our clients. You will become expert in some areas and diversify in others.
You will grow your industry and business specific knowledge in order to increase the impact of our service offering on the business.
Your proficiency level will grow in providing exceptional service to our clients, develop our talents and grow the firm and its brand. This by focusing on key areas like: solving problems, developing others and self, building relationships, adapting communication styles, managing change & ambiguity, developing business, managing quality and risk and delivering impactful results.




Let’s talk about you



Master’s degree in computer science, mathematics, physics, or other technical subjects.
At least 2 years of experience in data science or software development.
Skilled in advanced data analytics, identifying technology-purpose fit, and leading implementation projects.
Clear communicator of complex quantitative analysis to various stakeholders.
Proficient in data science, modelling/scripting, big data technologies (e.g., Python, (Py)SPARK, R); Scala and AWS technologies are a plus.
Experienced in data visualization, data engineering, test automation, scheduling technologies (e.g., Airflow), and GIT (e.g., Gitlab/GitHub).
Fluent in Dutch and English (French is a plus), proactive, responsible, team player, independent worker, analytical, and eager to learn.

Our Risk, Regulatory & Forensic practice is a global leader in helping clients manage risk and uncertainty from the boardroom to the network. We provide a broad array of services that allow our clients around the world to better measure, manage and control risk to enhance the reliability of systems and processes throughout their organization.



Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.


Why Deloitte?

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:



My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities


Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte


Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte


Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte


Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities




Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangementsremains essential in today's reality:



Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).


Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.




Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.


Why Deloitte?

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:

  • My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities

  • Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte

  • Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte

  • Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte

  • Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities



Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangementsremains essential in today's reality:

  • Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).

  • Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.



Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Title: Data Scientist - 024288
Description:
Role: Data Scientist - 024288

Location: VASS BRUSSELS

А global digital transformation company with a team of more than 4,900 global players in 26 countries – in Europe, America and Asia, working together to put organizations at the forefront of innovation by bringing together talent, knowledge and technology.

Our approach is based on conscious technology, through which we create positive environments and meaningful opportunities, always in our own way, making the complex simple.

VASS BeNeLux, in partnership with the European Commission, is currently seeking an Expert Data Scientist - 024288 to work from the European Commission.

The role:

Following tasks will be performed by external service provider:


Gathering business requirements
Participation in meetings with the project teams.
Identifying relevant data analytics and AI solutions that could be useful in relationship with a specific business need.
Conduct exploratory data analysis to understand and validate available data
Apply advanced data analysis methodologies to extract actionable insights from data
Contribute to the evolution of the Data Infrastructure components enabling PMO to exploit the latest developments in the Data, AI and Business Intelligence domain.
Effectively summarise, present and disseminate data-driven insights to audiences of different backgrounds and hierarchical levels
Design and develop Business Intelligence reports, Dashboards and other visualisation products.
Writing of technical documentation
Interaction with the business analysts, customer, users and project leaders.




You have:


To have a bachelor of minimum 3 years
In-depth knowledge of data warehouse/data lake design principles & architecture
In depth knowledge of Python and relevant Data Analytics and AI libraries
In depth knowledge of business intelligence reporting tools (SAP BI and Qlik)
Good theoretical understanding of state of the art Artificial Intelligence techniques
Ability to cope with fast changing technologies in the Data, AI and Business Intelligence domain




SPECIFIC EXPERTISE

Following specific expertise is mandatory for the performance of tasks:


at least 5 years of specific expertise in the creation of BI Reports using SAP BI and Qliksense
at least 3 years of specific expertise in using Python for Data Analytics




If you want to join a dynamic company where technological challenges will be found in your day to day we are waiting for you in the great VASS team.

And we encourage you to be the best version of yourself: Transformative, Creative, Honest, Vibrant!

At VASS we take action every day to achieve a favourable environment that facilitates and promotes equal opportunities, non-discrimination, diversity and inclusion of all people. We select our talent based on business needs, skills and merits. 🌟
Show more
