Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together

Job Description

We have an opening for a person with a passion for data science & AI, interested in solving concrete business projects in a wide variety of domains and applications.

In this role, you will work closely with other Data Profiles from Sopra Steria but also from our clients’ internal teams. You will lead the way and participate in multiple advanced analytics & AI projects from the ideation phase to the value delivery. Every step of the way, you will ensure the quality of the analytical solution as well as the actionability towards the business stakeholders.

Does this sound like your ideal day-to-day drill? Then don’t wait any longer and let’s meet.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:


You have multiple years of industry experience in building and delivering a variety of data science & AI applications / solutions
You understand that organizations today should make the most of the available information, in order to turn this information into value. You have acquired relevant skills through your past experiences
You are proficient in Python (all other programming languages are a plus).
You have worked on at least one cloud provider
You are motivated by obtaining concrete deliverables and results. You want to make a difference for the organizations you work for, and you like to be recognized for your input
You can work independently, but you also appreciate collaboration. You are open-minded and have no fear of expressing your opinion in a constructive way
You are proficient in English. You are also fluent in Dutch or French.
Experience in project management and people management is a plus


What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You’ll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.
Show more

We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Graduate Program - Innovation Impact -R&D Data Scientist Chemistry (d/f/m)
Description:
About the Innovation Impact Program Our 18-month Graduate Program starts on October 1st, 2025, at our Henkel Adhesive Technologies Innovation Center in Düsseldorf. You will be part of an exciting development journey, where you will receive a permanent contract from day one, relocation support, and hands-on experience across various innovative technologies. Upon completion, you will have the opportunity to transition into global roles within Henkel’s innovation network.

What You´ll Do


Partner with product developers and application engineers as part of our R&D team in Düsseldorf, Germany to understand technologies, data collection processes, and challenges driving the digital transformation within R&D
Design and conduct data analysis projects to identify trends and patterns in formulation data sets, and build and deploy machine learning models to predict formulation performance, stability, and quality
Collaborate closely with R&D colleagues to translate data insights into new formulations, product development decisions, and application processes - optimizing R&D workflows
Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards to effectively communicate insights to technical and business stakeholders
Leverage your digital skillset to drive awareness and application of data-based decision-making and digital tools across R&D
Support the digital transformation of R&D by implementing data-driven workflows for process development and knowledge management


What makes you a good fit


You have recently completed, or are about to complete, a Master’s or Ph.D. that combines a strong foundation in Chemistry, Engineering, or Materials Science with Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, or a related analytical field—for example, a Bachelor’s in a natural science and a digitally focused Master's, or interdisciplinary studies that enable you to understand both lab-based R&D and data-driven approaches
You bring first hands-on experience with data analysis and modeling in scientific or engineering contexts, and have a strong grasp of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, classification)
You are proficient in data tools such as Python or R, DoE software like Minitab or JMP, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau); experience with IoT, finite element analysis (FEA), and computational fluid dynamics (CFD) is a plus
You are interested in working in a laboratory environment, motivated to learn about formulations, product development, and R&D workflows, and keen to apply your skills in a hands-on setting
You enjoy collaborating with non-digital colleagues, and can confidently explain digital tools and data concepts in a simple, practical way to support their daily work
You are interested in growing your career in Henkel’s global Innovation network, with relocation as one possible path after the program.
Proficiency in English is essential, as you will work in an international environment


Ready to take the next step in your career? Visit our program landing page for full details and apply today.

Some perks of joining Henkel

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, generations and disabilities. If there are any specific accommodations or adjustments you require for the interview process or your on-site appointment, please inform us, and we'll do our best to accommodate your requests.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist – Python Migration & Grid Modelling




Location: Brussels (Monnoyer)

Duration: Initially Until 31/12/2025

Part-time: Can vary between 2 or 5 days a week

Setup: Freelance (day rate)




We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist to lead the industrialisation and full Python migration of our existing analytical scripts used in conjunction with DigSilent PowerFactory. This is a high-impact role requiring technical fluency, stakeholder collaboration, and a sharp eye for data integrity.

You will own the development of a robust, modular Python toolchain that replaces legacy scripts, enhances performance, and introduces new features. Key tasks include refactoring code to isolate PowerFactory dependencies, optimising performance for large-scale data, and ensuring input completeness.

You’ll collaborate closely with business experts to automate manual processes, ensuring the solution is scalable and production-ready. Your work will contribute directly to energy grid modelling, integrating new capacity changes based on complex hypotheses.




Key Technologies & Skills:

Python (minimum 5 years’ experience): Efficient, modular, and scalable programming
Advanced Analytics: Handling large datasets with performance in mind
Profiling & Optimisation: Speed and memory efficiency
Documentation & Maintainability: Clear code and user guidance
DigSilent PowerFactory: Integration understanding (desirable)
Electric Power Systems: Basic domain knowledge is a plus




Requirements:

Fluent in English and Dutch or French
Highly organised, autonomous, and deadline-focused
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Valid work and residence permit for Belgium (if non-EU)




This role offers a unique opportunity to merge data science with energy systems engineering, delivering real-world impact through technical innovation.

Show more

Title: AI Expert
Description:
Position Description

At CGI, we’re looking for AI experts who want to make a tangible impact. You’ll lead AI innovation, helping our clients unlock the true value of their data, while working with cutting-edge technologies in a team that values diversity and continuous learning.

Your role in our team


Lead AI Awareness: Conduct workshops to increase awareness of AI and demonstrate its value for our clients’ businesses.
Deliver AI Solutions: Use industry-specific methods to solve client challenges, create trusted data sets, and develop data pipelines for AI model training.
Accelerate Decision-Making: Guide clients toward “speed to trusted action” through AI solutions, discovering AI opportunities via AI Design Sprint workshops, and building AI centers of excellence with a focus on governance and ethical AI.
Develop & Optimize: Implement AI models and solutions, ensuring ethical and responsible practices, and optimize existing AI systems for better performance.
Full AI Lifecycle: Be involved in the full AI lifecycle, including data preparation, design, coding, testing, deployment, and support.
Best Practices & Knowledge Transfer: Create internal guidelines for AI, train internal teams, and contribute to best practices for ethical AI.
Stay Current: Keep up with the latest AI trends, technologies, and ethical standards, and address biases in AI datasets and models.
Document & Share: Maintain clear documentation of AI development processes and decisions, ensuring transparency


How You Strengthen Our Team

We need someone who can bring both expertise and a passion for AI:


Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models and AI solutions.
Expertise in at least 2 areas: Statistics, Regression, Clustering, Deep Learning, NLP, Computer Vision, Time Series, Machine Learning Visualization, or Tree Ensembles.
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, R, or Java, and familiarity with frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Experience with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Strong data management skills, including data preprocessing and analysis.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.
Commitment to ethical AI practices and staying up-to-date with the field’s advancements.
Ability to handle multiple projects in a dynamic environment.
Clear communication and documentation skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Fluency in French or Dutch, with strong English skills.
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or a related field.
Medior Profile: 3 to 6 years of experience.


A pre-employment screening is part of the application process

Why join CGI?

At CGI, we believe in responsible and human-centric AI. For over 30 years, we’ve helped organizations realize lasting value from their AI investments. We prioritize outcomes that benefit stakeholders and align with societal values. Here’s what we offer:


A collaborative environment in small, self-managing expert teams.
The opportunity to drive your career with space for continuous development.
Work with the latest AI technologies.
An attractive salary with excellent benefits.
A permanent contract from the start.
The opportunity to become a CGI shareholder.


What's in it for you ?


Direct impact on the future of AI within a leading IT & Business consultancy.
Work with the latest technologies in a supportive and dynamic environment.
Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning.
A focus on ethical AI and best practices in the field.
A diverse and inclusive workplace where your ideas are valued.


Join our team of experts and apply now!

Questions about the position? Ask them to Gregory Depasse, Head of AI via gregory.depasse@cgi.com.

For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com

We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

XX

Job Description

xx

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Ensemble, en tant que propriétaires, mettons notre savoir-faire à l’œuvre.

La vie chez CGI est ancrée dans l’actionnariat, le travail d’équipe, le respect et un sentiment d’appartenance. Chez nous, vous pourrez exploiter votre plein potentiel parce que…

Nous vous invitons à devenir propriétaire dès le jour 1 alors que nous travaillons ensemble à faire de notre rêve une réalité. C’est pourquoi nous nous désignons comme associés de CGI, plutôt que comme employés. Nous tirons profit des retombées de notre succès collectif et contribuons activement à l’orientation et à la stratégie de notre entreprise.

Votre travail crée de la valeur. Vous élaborerez des solutions novatrices et développerez des relations durables avec vos collègues et clients, tout en ayant accès à des capacités mondiales pour concrétiser vos idées, saisir de nouvelles opportunités, et bénéficier d’une expertise sectorielle et technologique de pointe.

Vous ferez évoluer votre carrière en vous joignant à une entreprise bâtie pour croître et durer. Vous serez soutenus par des leaders qui ont votre santé et bien-être à cœur et qui vous permettront de saisir des occasions afin de parfaire vos compétences et élargir les horizons.

Joignez-vous à nous, l’une des plus importantes entreprises de conseil en technologie de l’information (TI) et en management au monde.


Show more

  • Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models and AI solutions.
  • Expertise in at least 2 areas: Statistics, Regression, Clustering, Deep Learning, NLP, Computer Vision, Time Series, Machine Learning Visualization, or Tree Ensembles.
  • Proficiency in programming languages like Python, R, or Java, and familiarity with frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
  • Experience with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
  • Strong data management skills, including data preprocessing and analysis.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.
  • Commitment to ethical AI practices and staying up-to-date with the field’s advancements.
  • Ability to handle multiple projects in a dynamic environment.
  • Clear communication and documentation skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Fluency in French or Dutch, with strong English skills.
  • A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Medior Profile: 3 to 6 years of experience.

A pre-employment screening is part of the application process

Why join CGI?

At CGI, we believe in responsible and human-centric AI. For over 30 years, we’ve helped organizations realize lasting value from their AI investments. We prioritize outcomes that benefit stakeholders and align with societal values. Here’s what we offer:

  • A collaborative environment in small, self-managing expert teams.
  • The opportunity to drive your career with space for continuous development.
  • Work with the latest AI technologies.
  • An attractive salary with excellent benefits.
  • A permanent contract from the start.
  • The opportunity to become a CGI shareholder.

What's in it for you ?

  • Direct impact on the future of AI within a leading IT & Business consultancy.
  • Work with the latest technologies in a supportive and dynamic environment.
  • Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning.
  • A focus on ethical AI and best practices in the field.
  • A diverse and inclusive workplace where your ideas are valued.

Join our team of experts and apply now!

Questions about the position? Ask them to Gregory Depasse, Head of AI via gregory.depasse@cgi.com.

For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com

We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

XX

Job Description

xx

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Ensemble, en tant que propriétaires, mettons notre savoir-faire à l’œuvre.

La vie chez CGI est ancrée dans l’actionnariat, le travail d’équipe, le respect et un sentiment d’appartenance. Chez nous, vous pourrez exploiter votre plein potentiel parce que…

Nous vous invitons à devenir propriétaire dès le jour 1 alors que nous travaillons ensemble à faire de notre rêve une réalité. C’est pourquoi nous nous désignons comme associés de CGI, plutôt que comme employés. Nous tirons profit des retombées de notre succès collectif et contribuons activement à l’orientation et à la stratégie de notre entreprise.

Votre travail crée de la valeur. Vous élaborerez des solutions novatrices et développerez des relations durables avec vos collègues et clients, tout en ayant accès à des capacités mondiales pour concrétiser vos idées, saisir de nouvelles opportunités, et bénéficier d’une expertise sectorielle et technologique de pointe.

Vous ferez évoluer votre carrière en vous joignant à une entreprise bâtie pour croître et durer. Vous serez soutenus par des leaders qui ont votre santé et bien-être à cœur et qui vous permettront de saisir des occasions afin de parfaire vos compétences et élargir les horizons.

Joignez-vous à nous, l’une des plus importantes entreprises de conseil en technologie de l’information (TI) et en management au monde.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Freelance/Contract Senior Data Scientist – ML Engineer (Brussels-Based, Hybrid – 12-Month Contract)




We are currently seeking an experienced and driven Senior Data Scientist – ML Engineer (Freelance/Contract) to join our growing Data & AI team in Brussels, Belgium. This is a 12-month contract position with a strong likelihood of extension, offering a hybrid working arrangement—2 days per week on-site in Brussels and remote flexibility the rest of the time.

You will work on cutting-edge machine learning projects across various industries, helping to build impactful, data-driven solutions in collaboration with a cross-functional team of experts.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and algorithms
Analyze large, complex datasets to identify patterns and generate insights
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines for ingestion, transformation, and processing
Translate business needs into effective ML-driven technical solutions
Stay current with industry trends in AI and machine learning
Contribute to team capabilities through knowledge sharing and best practice development




Requirements:

Master’s or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline
5+ years of hands-on experience in data science or machine learning roles
Strong proficiency in Python or R, and familiarity with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
Familiarity with Databricks is a plus
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Fluency in English, with professional proficiency in either French or Dutch (mandatory)
Must be located in Belgium and available to work on-site in Brussels 2 days per week
Work permit sponsorship is not available




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with big data tools (Hadoop, Spark, Hive)
Knowledge of MLOps practices and deployment tools
Background in natural language processing (NLP) or computer vision
Contributions to open-source projects or published academic work

Title: AI Engineer - Energy and Utilities
Description:
Position Description

As an AI engineer, you will join our international emerging technology practice. You will be working in an agile team at one of our customers where you will take the responsibility of further implementation and expansion of their generative AI platform. You will set-up data connections with other data sources like Salesforce and ServiceNow. If you are passionate about information technology and are excited about continuous learning opportunities we want to hear from you.

Your role in our team


Your will create AI orchestrator/pipelines using Microsoft nuget packages
You will deploy AI models with monitoring capabilities to ensure reliability and accuracy using MLOps principles.
Finetuning of GPT3.5 and GPT4.0 models: focus of AI model on specific domains of expertise.
You will handle the Integration of the AI solution within the existing application landscape.
You will work as part of a team in close collaboration with architects and data engineers to Build complete end-to-end AI solutions.


How You Strengthen Our Team


You have at least 3 years of experience in Python and/or .NET development
You have already a first professional experience
Familiar with AI solutions on the Azure ecosystem (cognitive search, OpenAI)
Previous experience with embedding datasets in Cognitive Services for Semantic search.
Experience in working with Vector databases
Knowledge of the Langchain framework
You have mathematical mindset and like solving complex problems.
Native NL or FR and a very good lEN level
Education and Certification
Bachelor or master degree in computer science, or equivalent


A pre-employment screening is part of the application process

Why CGI?

CGI is one of the world's largest IT consultancy companies. Our people keep Belgium running. Government institutions, banks, infrastructure organisations, energy , utilities, manufacturing and lifesciences companies are CGI's clients. We work on interesting projects that touch the everyday lives of millions of people. We have a regional presence, reinforced with global domain expertise, our ecosystem and colleagues spread across the globe.

We are proud of the impactful projects we make a success together with our colleagues.

At CGI, we value diversity and inclusion as it not only promotes collaboration, but also often leads to better results. We look forward to your contribution to our team!

Working in small self-managing teams consisting of experts in your field.


Directing your own career with the space to keep developing yourself.
You work with the latest technologies.
An excellent salary and attractive fringe benefits
An immediate permanent contract
And the opportunity to become a CGI shareholder


Join our team of experts and apply now!

Questions about the position? Ask them to Bart Jansen, Director Energy sector , via bart.jansen@cgi.com.

For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com

We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Title: Data Scientist - 024288
Description:
Role: Data Scientist - 024288

Location: VASS BRUSSELS

А global digital transformation company with a team of more than 4,900 global players in 26 countries – in Europe, America and Asia, working together to put organizations at the forefront of innovation by bringing together talent, knowledge and technology.

Our approach is based on conscious technology, through which we create positive environments and meaningful opportunities, always in our own way, making the complex simple.

VASS BeNeLux, in partnership with the European Commission, is currently seeking an Expert Data Scientist - 024288 to work from the European Commission.

The role:

Following tasks will be performed by external service provider:


Gathering business requirements
Participation in meetings with the project teams.
Identifying relevant data analytics and AI solutions that could be useful in relationship with a specific business need.
Conduct exploratory data analysis to understand and validate available data
Apply advanced data analysis methodologies to extract actionable insights from data
Contribute to the evolution of the Data Infrastructure components enabling PMO to exploit the latest developments in the Data, AI and Business Intelligence domain.
Effectively summarise, present and disseminate data-driven insights to audiences of different backgrounds and hierarchical levels
Design and develop Business Intelligence reports, Dashboards and other visualisation products.
Writing of technical documentation
Interaction with the business analysts, customer, users and project leaders.




You have:


To have a bachelor of minimum 3 years
In-depth knowledge of data warehouse/data lake design principles & architecture
In depth knowledge of Python and relevant Data Analytics and AI libraries
In depth knowledge of business intelligence reporting tools (SAP BI and Qlik)
Good theoretical understanding of state of the art Artificial Intelligence techniques
Ability to cope with fast changing technologies in the Data, AI and Business Intelligence domain




SPECIFIC EXPERTISE

Following specific expertise is mandatory for the performance of tasks:


at least 5 years of specific expertise in the creation of BI Reports using SAP BI and Qliksense
at least 3 years of specific expertise in using Python for Data Analytics




If you want to join a dynamic company where technological challenges will be found in your day to day we are waiting for you in the great VASS team.

And we encourage you to be the best version of yourself: Transformative, Creative, Honest, Vibrant!

At VASS we take action every day to achieve a favourable environment that facilitates and promotes equal opportunities, non-discrimination, diversity and inclusion of all people. We select our talent based on business needs, skills and merits. 🌟

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application! 

You are fully convinced that data science isn’t a hype, but you also believe that, in order to be valuable and really make a company smarter, it must be done right. Your goal is therefore to create the most impactful solution possible in the quickest and easiest way possible so that real value can be extracted from data and artificial intelligence. 

Qualifications

We’re looking for someone who has:


A master’s degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, or a related field.
2 to 4 years of hands-on experience developing and implementing AI/ML models in production environments.
Strong Python programming skills, including experience with API-building frameworks such as FastAPI and prototyping tools like Streamlit.
Experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar is considered a strong asset.
Solid understanding of machine learning including model evaluation techniques and familiarity with advanced applications such as: NLP, forecasting, optimization, computer vision.
Experience in working with cloud-based environments (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and ML pipelines is a strong asset.
Experience with Generative AI technologies, prompt engineering, and large language models, is a strong asset.
Hands-on knowledge of vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Azure AI Search) for semantic search and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines is a strong asset.
Strong communication and business analysis skills and genuinely interested in understanding the customer’s business context and challenges.
You can explain complex technical concepts in simple, accessible language to non-technical stakeholders.
A collaborative, open-minded mindset and a drive to keep learning in a fast-evolving field.
You're fluent in Dutch or French, as well as English.


What we can offer:


A dynamic role within OptimAI, a leading AI competence center focused on applied, impactful AI.
The opportunity to work on real-world projects across sectors, from logistics and government to healthcare and finance.
Access to expert colleagues, mentorship, and tailored learning opportunities to accelerate your growth.
A flexible hybrid work model and a strong focus on work-life balance.
A culture of innovation, inclusion, and continuous improvement where your ideas and input are valued.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application! 

At OptimAI, we combine the best of both worlds: data science and supply chain optimization. You will be part of a forward-thinking team where you can shape the future of data science and supply chain management. This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference and grow your career in a field that is rapidly evolving and in high demand.

If you thrive on challenge, continuous learning, and want to make an impact in a fast-growing field, apply now to join the OptimAI Team.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Solver - Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist
Description:
About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.




At Exsolvæ, our "Solvers" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.




We are seeking a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist with a proven ability to design, develop, and deploy transformative AI and machine learning solutions.




Your Role:

As a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist, you will work alongside multidisciplinary teams to unlock the full potential of data assets for clients. You will design state-of-the-art ML models, develop data-driven insights, and deploy production-grade AI solutions. Leveraging your expertise, you will help clients overcome their most pressing challenges and create sustainable value using AI and ML.




What We’re Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications

Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or a related field.
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience
Programming Skills: Expertise in Python and SQL, with experience in big data tools like Apache Spark or Databricks.
Machine Learning Mastery: Proficiency in TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn for designing, training, and deploying ML models.
Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI for scalable AI deployments.
Data Visualization: Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Python-based libraries such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly.
Statistics and Mathematics: Deep understanding of linear algebra, calculus, probability, and advanced statistical techniques.
Soft Skills: Exceptional communication, critical thinking, and stakeholder management skills.




Preferred Skills

Familiarity with advanced ML techniques, such as reinforcement learning, graph ML, and large language models (LLMs).
Experience with MLOps tools like MLflow, Kubeflow, and Docker/Kubernetes.
Knowledge of causal inference frameworks (e.g., DoWhy, EconML) and time-series forecasting methods.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate, AWS Certified Machine Learning, or Google Professional ML Engineer.




What You’ll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to identify data challenges, define objectives, and recommend AI/ML solutions that align with business goals.
Model Development: Design and train advanced machine learning models using frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Insight Generation: Transform complex datasets into actionable insights using statistical analysis and advanced visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.




Technical Implementation

Machine Learning Solutions: Develop models for classification, regression, clustering, and NLP using modern techniques, including deep learning and reinforcement learning.
Data Engineering: Collaborate with Data Engineers to build robust data pipelines and optimize data for ML applications using platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP.
MLOps: Deploy and maintain models in production environments using MLOps pipelines with tools like MLflow or Kubeflow.
Cloud Deployment: Implement AI workflows on cloud platforms such as Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI with scalability and performance in mind.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on advancements in AI/ML technologies and incorporate state-of-the-art practices into client projects.
Explore innovative methodologies like transfer learning, Vision Transformers, and graph neural networks to enhance solutions.




Project Management

Lead end-to-end ML projects, from problem definition to model deployment, ensuring alignment with client objectives and deadlines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Engineers and Solution Architects, to deliver comprehensive solutions.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams in adopting and managing AI/ML solutions.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the scalability and performance of deployed AI systems.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Work on transformative AI/ML initiatives across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and energy.
Continuous Learning: Access to the latest tools, certifications, and training opportunities to remain at the cutting edge of AI and ML.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values knowledge sharing and collective growth.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.




If you are a driven professional with a passion for Artificial Intelligence and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful AI/ML solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Research Engineer
Description:
We Are Hiring: Research Engineer - HiL Engineer for ADAS

Location: 📍Zaventem (Hybrid – minimum 2 days/week on-site)

Start Date: 📅June 2025







About ALTEN Belgium

At ALTEN Belgium, we are part of the ALTEN Group, a global leader in engineering and technology consulting. Our mission is to support our clients’ development strategies in the fields of innovation, R&D, and IT systems. With a strong presence in Belgium’s industrial ecosystem, we work closely with leading companies in the automotive, aerospace, energy, and life sciences sectors.




As part of our continued growth and commitment to cutting-edge innovation, we are looking for a Research/HiL Engineer for ADAS to strengthen our team and contribute to a new and exciting chapter in automotive development.







About the Role 💼

Your main responsibility will be to support the development and testing of next-generation Advanced Driver Assistance Systems. In this role, you will help shape future automotive safety and autonomy features by working on hardware-in-the-loop setups, scenario simulations, and performance validation.




You will be part of a forward-thinking team contributing to the modernization of ADAS testing practices—improving capability, reducing costs, and addressing new development and quality challenges in a rapidly evolving automotive landscape.




Key Responsibilities 🔧

Set up a new-generation ADAS HiL system using state-of-the-art tools and hardware.
Test and validate the HiL setup’s capabilities for functional evaluation of ADAS features.
Generate virtual twins to simulate real-world driving scenarios for testing and validation.
Define and apply methodologies to assess system performance across various metrics.




Your Profile ✅

Experience level: Medior (2–5 years)
Solid experience with HiL systems; previous work on ADAS or automotive control systems is a strong plus
Familiarity with Dspace toolchains is highly appreciated
Experience working in agile development teams (3-week sprints)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a hands-on mindset




Work Arrangement 🌍

Hybrid work model: Minimum 2 days/week on-site in Zaventem (which days are flexible)
Remote work: Permitted for the remaining time
Travel: Sporadic, on an ad-hoc basis only




Why Join Us? 🚀

This is a new opening tied to a major phase in an innovative automotive project. At ALTEN Belgium, you'll join a collaborative, engineering-driven culture where you can grow your skills and contribute to impactful technology that drives the future of mobility.




Ready to accelerate your career? 📣

Apply now and take part in shaping the next generation of intelligent driving systems with ALTEN Belgium.

Title: AI engineer Consultant
Description:
The team, position & mission:




Are you passionate about data? Do you like creating a real impact by tackling some real-world problems our clients face by developing algorithms for recommendation engines, developing natural language processing algorithms or employing deep learning methods on information? If you answered yes, this could be the job for you! As an AI engineer, your job will be to propose and develop advanced analytical models for a series of different clients and in different industries like life science, media, public, banking, insurance and others.




Your key areas of responsibility as AI engineer Consultant:




Proposing and developing advanced analytical models for a series of different clients and in different industries like life science, media, public, banking, insurance and others.
Working as a consultant for big clients, accompanied by your colleague experts in the field. An analytical career path will help you to develop your skills and obtain your objectives on the long term.




As an ideal candidate you have:




A master’s degree or PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business Engineering, Physics or any related field
2-5 years relevant experience in data science / data analysis / data mining
Passionate about data and/or statistical analysis, with mathematics and modelling skills
Experience in at least one of the following sectors: Banking, Finance, Risk, Marketing, Customer Intelligence, Life Sciences
Experience with SQL
Some experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, ...) is a plus
Experience with applying regression, classification, natural language processing, clustering/ segmentation, time-series forecasting, anomaly detection or predictive maintenance is a must
Proficiency in data sourcing (web-scraping, API, etc.), data transformation and data preparation techniques
Excellent programming knowledge in Python and/or R
Good coding practices and code refactoring experience is an advantage
Interest in machine learning, deep learning and/or MLOps
Experience using Cloud Data Platforms (Azure, GCP, ...) for Data Science projects is a plus
Ability to understand the business requirements and develop new/existing algorithms to satisfy those requirements
Strong communication and presentation skills
Being able to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience and explainable AI is an advantage
Conceptual and creative thinking
A plus: Hands on experience in Enterprise Intelligence (e.g., Data Warehousing, Data Management, Business Intelligence, Analytics, Big Data ecosystem)
Fluent in English and French and/or Dutch
Experience in using tools leveraging Generative AI and/or developing yourself projects that make use of Generative AI is a plus




What we offer you:




Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative offices in Brussels
We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
Read more about the benefits we offer here




About Orange Business:

Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.




Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a newly created division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 9 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.




With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.

Title: Expert Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🚀 Your Role

At Dataroots, our consulting services are focused on designing and delivering AI-powered solutions tailored to optimize business processes. As an Expert Machine Learning Engineer, you'll join a collaborative team focused on building machine learning models that bring production-ready solutions to life.




Your passion for data and its potential will allow you to develop, deploy, and optimize advanced machine learning models. You’ll experiment with the latest approaches to ensure that every client receives best-in-class solutions. Working closely with our Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists, you’ll help execute projects across diverse industries with a comprehensive, quality-driven, end-to-end approach.




As a senior team member, you'll mentor your peers, share your expertise, and keep up with the latest advancements in the field, ensuring continuous growth for yourself and the team.




🎉 What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




💼 What we’re looking for

You bring the following qualities & experiences to the role:

Master’s or Doctorate in a quantitative field, with mastery in Machine Learning.
4+ years of industry experience in machine learning and big data.
In-depth understanding of software design principles.
Strong theoretical grounding and practical expertise in general machine learning and deep learning.
Strong skills in Python & SQL. Knowledge of an additional programming language is an advantage.
Proven track record in deploying ML models and deep expertise in MLOps.
Experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and orchestration tools like Airflow, Prefect or Dagster.
Solid grasp of cloud- & data engineering. Proven experience with cloud services like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
GenAI familiarity is a big advantage.
Excited to work with large datasets and be able to tackle problems pragmatically.
Excellent communication skills to translate complex solutions into clear client deliverables.
Fluency in English. Speaking Dutch/French fluently is a very big advantage.
Consulting experience is a big plus.




💰 The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Substantial amount of holidays

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organisation of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to join Dataroots as an Expert Machine Learning Engineer? We can't wait to meet you—apply today! 🎉
